TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GridView extends System.Windows.Controls.ViewBase implements class System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild

Docs.summary: Represents a view mode that displays data items in columns for a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GridView class and its supporting classes provide the infrastructure to display data items that are specified for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView> control in a series of columns. The columns have column headers, which are buttons that are derived from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase>, and you can reorder the columns by using drag-and-drop operations. Note that the columns of a GridView display data and do not provide direct access to the source of the data.
To specify a GridView as the view mode for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView>, set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView.View%2A> property to a GridView object.
The GridView class is derived from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ViewBase>. You can define custom views by inheriting from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ViewBase> class that provides the supporting elements for a view. For more information, see [How to: Create a Custom View Mode for a ListView](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The following illustration shows an example of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView> that uses a GridView.
![ListView with GridView output](~/add/media/listviewgridview.JPG "ListView with GridView output")
The columns in a GridView are defined as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn> objects. In [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)], you can define <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn> objects as child elements of the GridView. In code, you can add a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridViewColumn> to the GridView by using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.Columns%2A> property and the <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Add%2A> method that is defined for the <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601> class. Similarly, you can use other <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601> methods such as <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Remove%2A> and <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Insert%2A> to modify the columns in a GridView.
The following example shows how to define the columns of a GridView.
[!code-xml[ListViewCode#GridViewColumn](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/ListViewCode/Window1.xaml#gridviewcolumn)] [!code-cs[ListViewCode#GridViewColumn](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ListViewCode/Window1.xaml.cs#gridviewcolumn)] [!code-vb[ListViewCode#GridViewColumn](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/listviewcode/window1.xaml.vb#gridviewcolumn)]
To style the rows in a GridView, define a style for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListViewItem> controls in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView>.
To add visual elements, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.CheckBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> control, to a GridView, use templates or styles. For an example, see [How to: Create ListViewItems with a CheckBox](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following example shows how to define a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView> control that implements a GridView as its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView.View%2A>.
[!code-xml[ListViewSnips#1](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/ListViewSnips/Window1.xaml#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks Text cannot be added to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> object. Calling this method will cause an exception.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the style to apply to column headers.
Docs.value: The that is used to define the display properties for column headers. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ColumnHeaderContainerStyle property and the property are both used to define the visual tree for the objects that represent the column headers in a . The ColumnHeaderContainerStyle property can also define column header content when a is not by specified by defining a for the object. This property represents one of several ways to lay out and style column headers. For more information, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). When you set styles, there are some restrictions. For more information, see [Styling and Templating](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ## XAML Values `ResourceExtension` One of the following: `StaticResource`, or `DynamicResource`. See [XAML Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). `StyleResourceKey` The key that identifies the style being requested. The key refers to an existing resource in a . > [!NOTE] > Property element syntax is technically possible, but not recommended. See [Inline Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). A binding reference using or is also possible, but uncommon. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows how to define the ColumnHeaderContainerStyle property. [!code-xml[ListViewTemplate#GridViewHeaderStyle](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/listviewtemplate/window1.xaml#gridviewheaderstyle)] [!code-xml[ListViewTemplate#GridViewColumnHeaderContainerTemplate](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/listviewtemplate/window1.xaml#gridviewcolumnheadercontainertemplate)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a composite string that specifies how to format the column headers of the if they are displayed as strings.
Docs.value: A composite string that specifies how to format the column headers of the if they are displayed as strings. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the , , or property is set, this property is ignored. You can use several properties to specify the format of the column headers. If more than one property is set, the column header is formatted with the value of the property that has the highest priority. The format for a column can be set on several types. The following list shows the properties that can be used to format the column headers, ordered from lowest to highest priority: - ColumnHeaderStringFormat - - ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to **true**|None|

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty ColumnHeaderStringFormatProperty

Gets or sets a template to use to display the column headers.
Docs.value: The to use to display the column headers as part of the . The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the ColumnHeaderTemplate property and the property are both set, the ColumnHeaderTemplate property takes precedence. This property represents one of several ways to lay out and style column headers. For more information, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values `ResourceExtension` One of the following: `StaticResource`, or `DynamicResource`. See [XAML Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). `TemplateResourceKey` The key that identifies the template being requested. The key refers to an existing resource in a . > [!NOTE] > Property element syntax is technically possible, but not recommended. See [Inline Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). A binding reference using or is also possible, but uncommon. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows how to set the ColumnHeaderTemplate property. [!code-xml[ListViewTemplate#GridViewHeaderTemplate](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/listviewtemplate/window1.xaml#gridviewheadertemplate)] [!code-xml[ListViewTemplate#GridViewColumnHeaderContainerTemplate](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/listviewtemplate/window1.xaml#gridviewcolumnheadercontainertemplate)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the selector object that provides logic for selecting a template to use for each column header.
Docs.value: The object that determines the data template to use for each column header. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you do not set this property, the default logic is to use the property for all columns if it is defined. If the property and the ColumnHeaderTemplateSelector property are both set, the property takes precedence. This property represents one of several ways to lay out and style column headers. For more information, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values `ResourceExtension` One of the following: `StaticResource`, or `DynamicResource`. See [XAML Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). `DataTemplateSelectorClassKey` The key that identifies the selector implementation being requested. The key refers to a derived class that implements a practical override. For information about how to map your custom class, see [XAML Namespaces and Namespace Mapping for WPF XAML](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). You can also programmatically add an instance of your class as a resource to the application resource dictionary. `MyDataTemplateSelectorImplementation` A class derived from that implements a practical override. For information about how to map your custom class, see [XAML Namespaces and Namespace Mapping for WPF XAML](../Topic/XAML%20Namespaces%20and%20Namespace%20Mapping%20for%20WPF%20XAML.md). ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the content of a tooltip that appears when the mouse pointer pauses over one of the column headers.
Docs.value: An object that represents the content that appears as a tooltip when the mouse pointer is paused over one of the column headers. The default value is not defined.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property represents one of several ways to lay out and style column headers. For more information, see [GridView Column Header Styles and Templates Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Property Element Usage ``` - or - ``` ## XAML Values `toolTipContent` A string that becomes the display text for the ColumnHeaderToolTip. `toolTipObjectContent` An object to use as the content for the tooltip. Typically, this object is a or some other element that defines a layout for the , such as a text element. In this usage, a element is implicitly created from the parsed [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], and the `toolTipObjectContent` content is set as its property. <`ToolTip` .../> See . ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows how to set the ColumnHeaderToolTip property. [!code-xml[ListViewCode#GridViewAllowsColumnReorderPart1](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/ListViewCode/Window1.xaml#gridviewallowscolumnreorderpart1)] [!code-xml[ListViewCode#GridViewAllowsColumnReorderPart2](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/ListViewCode/Window1.xaml#gridviewallowscolumnreorderpart2)] [!code-cs[ListViewCode#GridViewAllowsColumnReorder](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/ListViewCode/Window1.xaml.cs#gridviewallowscolumnreorder)] [!code-vb[ListViewCode#GridViewAllowsColumnReorder](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/listviewcode/window1.xaml.vb#gridviewallowscolumnreorder)]

To get, set, or change the columns that are defined for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView> object, use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.GridView.Columns%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the key that references the style that is defined for each in a .
Docs.value: A that references the style for each . The default value references the default style for a control in the current theme.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage See Remarks.

Docs.summary: Gets the key that references the style that is defined for the control that encloses the content that is displayed by a .
Docs.value: A that references the that is applied to the control for a . The default value is the style for the object of a in the current theme.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this read-only static property in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] by assigning its static value to another property value. Specifically, this property's static value defines the resource key that is used to look up the default style of a . To redefine this style, reference the GridViewScrollViewerStyleKey by using the [x:Static Markup Extension](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and assign that value as the [x:Key Directive](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) of the new . ## XAML Text Usage See Remarks.

Docs.summary: Gets the key that references the style that is defined for the .
Docs.value: A that references the that is applied to the . The default value is the style for the in the current theme.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this read-only static property in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] by assigning its static value to another property value. Specifically, this property's static value defines the resource key that is used to look up the default style. To redefine this style, reference the GridViewStyleKey by using the [x:Static Markup Extension](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and assign that value as the [x:Key Directive](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) of the new . You can use this read-only property in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] as an [x:Key Directive](../Topic/x:Key%20Directive.md) of a that redefines the for the . ## XAML Text Usage See Remarks.
